intro: Gomphrena occulta, commonly known as the hidden gomphrena, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or red in color, which bloom during the summer months. Gomphrena occulta is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and long-lasting blooms. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
